channel.title: Command requirement 639
channel.description: Im using 639 but i cant manage to make command a requirement. What i mean that you need to have fow things in your inventory to make command. i managed to make command delete that item but you can cast it without having it. What should ido?

item.title: Command requirement 639
item.dc:creator: @skupas skupas
item.description:
@skupas wrote:

Check to see if the player has the required items. [code=Java] if (command.equals("check")) { final int id = Integer.parseInt(args[0]); final int amount = IntegerParseInt(args[1]); sendMessage(player, String.format("You %s have the required items", (player.getInventory().contains(id, amount)) ? "do" : "don't")); } [/code]

So i have to combine this with my command right? Or not?? There is my command

if (command[0].equals("room1")) { player.teleport(xxxx, yyyy, 0); player.getInventory().deleteItem(76, 1); }

Read full topic

item.title: Command requirement 639
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

skupas:

Im using 639 but i cant manage to make command a requirement. What i mean that you need to have fow things in your inventory to make command. i managed to make command delete that item but you can cast it without having it. What should ido?

Check to see if the player has the required items.

if (command.equals("check")) {
    final int id = Integer.parseInt(args[0]);
    final int amount = IntegerParseInt(args[1]);
    sendMessage(player, String.format("You %s have the required items", (player.getInventory().contains(id, amount)) ? "do" : "don't"));
}

Read full topic
